context.setting: Home kitchen, evening call with extended family
context.background: Annual family reunion planning with multiple generations and preferences
context.tension_point: Older family members want familiar destination while younger generation wants adventure
context.expected_outcome: Compromise destination that accommodates different age groups and interests

participants.name: Margaret Thompson

behavioral_traits.verbal_tics: Says 'what if we' frequently, shuffles through papers
behavioral_traits.emotional_tells: Voice gets softer when trying to mediate conflicts

sample_dialogue: What if we looked for somewhere that has both relaxation and activities?
I want to make sure everyone feels included in this decision.
Let's think about what worked well for us in previous years.

participants.name: Robert Thompson

behavioral_traits.under_pressure: Becomes more stubborn, cites more precedents
behavioral_traits.verbal_tics: Says 'like we always do' frequently, sighs audibly
behavioral_traits.emotional_tells: Voice gets gruffer when feeling pressured to change

sample_dialogue: Like we always do, the lake house works perfectly fine for everyone.
Why fix something that isn't broken? We've been going there for fifteen years.
These adventure trips sound expensive and complicated for the older folks.

participants.name: Jessica Miller

behavioral_traits.speech_patterns: Excited about new experiences, uses vivid descriptions
behavioral_traits.emotional_tells: Voice gets higher when excited about possibilities

sample_dialogue: Imagine how amazing it would be to try white-water rafting together!
The kids are finally old enough for real adventures - let's take advantage!
We could do a national park tour - there's something for every generation.

conversation_flow.description: Margaret initiates planning discussion, Robert suggests usual location, Jessica proposes alternatives
Generational preferences clash, practical concerns versus adventure desires debated
Compromise location with mix of relaxation and adventure activities
key_points: Mountain resort with varied activities chosen

specific_assignments.task: Research mountain resort options with multi-generational activities
specific_assignments.context: Find location that balances adventure opportunities with comfortable accommodations

specific_assignments.task: Create activity survey for all family members
specific_assignments.context: Gather input on preferred activities and accessibility needs

scheduled_items.purpose: Finalize destination, dates, and coordinate booking responsibilities

context.setting: Bride's apartment, video call with wedding planner and concerned parent
context.background: Wedding planning session with mounting costs and family pressure
context.tension_point: Wedding planner suggests expensive upgrades while budget-conscious decisions create family tension
context.expected_outcome: Realistic budget allocation that balances desires with financial constraints

participants.name: Emily Rodriguez

behavioral_traits.verbal_tics: Says 'it's going to be perfect' frequently, shows pictures
behavioral_traits.emotional_tells: Voice gets strained when discussing budget cuts

sample_dialogue: It's going to be perfect - imagine the photos with those upgraded floral arrangements!
This is your special day - you can't compromise on the things that really matter.
I know the budget is tight, but these little touches make all the difference.

participants.name: Sarah Chen

behavioral_traits.under_pressure: Cites more specific numbers and concerns
behavioral_traits.emotional_tells: Voice gets tighter when discussing overspending

sample_dialogue: But realistically, we're already 30% over the original budget.
These upgrades are beautiful, but we need to think about the bigger picture.
What's the total impact if we say yes to all these additional items?

participants.name: Michael Chen

behavioral_traits.under_pressure: Becomes more blunt about financial realities
behavioral_traits.verbal_tics: Says 'the bottom line is' frequently, speaks firmly
behavioral_traits.emotional_tells: Longer pauses when discussing financial stress

sample_dialogue: The bottom line is we can't afford to go into debt for one day.
I want Sarah to have a beautiful wedding, but we need to be responsible.
Let's focus on what's truly important and cut the extras.

conversation_flow.description: Emily presents upgrade options, Sarah shows interest, Michael expresses budget concerns
Detailed cost discussion, emotional tension between dream wedding and financial reality
Compromise plan with selective upgrades and creative alternatives

specific_assignments.task: Source alternative vendors for selected items
specific_assignments.context: Find comparable quality options within revised budget parameters

specific_assignments.task: Coordinate DIY elements with wedding party
specific_assignments.context: Organize friends and family to help with decorations and favors

scheduled_items.purpose: Confirm all vendor selections within approved budget and timeline

scenarios.scenario_title: Elderly Parent Care - Living Arrangement Decision

context.setting: Family living room, difficult family discussion
context.background: Adult children discussing care options for aging parent after recent health scare
context.tension_point: Parent wants independence while children worry about safety and appropriate care
context.expected_outcome: Develop care plan that balances independence with safety and family peace of mind

participants.name: Dorothy Williams

behavioral_traits.speech_patterns: Firm about independence, references past capabilities
behavioral_traits.under_pressure: Becomes more adamant, cites examples of competence
behavioral_traits.verbal_tics: Says 'I'm perfectly capable' frequently, sits straighter
behavioral_traits.emotional_tells: Voice quavers slightly when feeling overwhelmed

sample_dialogue: I'm perfectly capable of taking care of myself - I've been doing it for 40 years.
This is still my home, and I'm not ready to give up my independence.
One little incident doesn't mean I need to be treated like a child.

participants.name: James Williams

behavioral_traits.speech_patterns: Gentle but persistent, uses inclusive language
behavioral_traits.under_pressure: Becomes more detailed about safety concerns
behavioral_traits.verbal_tics: Says 'we just want what's best' frequently, leans forward
behavioral_traits.emotional_tells: Voice gets softer when discussing fears

sample_dialogue: We just want what's best for you, Mom - we're worried about your safety.
What if we looked into some in-home help, just a few hours a day?
Nobody's talking about taking away your independence - we want to support it.

participants.name: Linda Foster

behavioral_traits.speech_patterns: Research-focused, cites specific options and costs
behavioral_traits.verbal_tics: Says 'I've researched' frequently, shows printed materials
behavioral_traits.emotional_tells: Speaks faster when trying to convince others

sample_dialogue: I've researched several assisted living communities that are really quite nice.
The statistics show that seniors living alone have three times more accidents.
We need to be proactive here - waiting for another incident isn't an option.

conversation_flow.description: James raises safety concerns, Dorothy asserts independence, Linda presents research
Emotional discussion of fears, capabilities, and family responsibilities
Graduated care plan with trial period and regular family check-ins
key_points: In-home aide 3 days per week agreed

specific_assignments.task: Research and interview in-home care agencies
specific_assignments.context: Find reputable agency that matches Mom's personality and needs

specific_assignments.task: Install medical alert system and teach Mom how to use it
specific_assignments.context: Ensure emergency response capability while maintaining independence

scheduled_items.date_time: First Sunday of each month at 2 PM
scheduled_items.purpose: Assess care plan effectiveness and adjust as needed based on Mom's comfort and safety

context.setting: Family car, driving home from DMV after teen passed driving test
context.background: New teenage driver wanting car privileges while parents establish safety rules and boundaries
context.tension_point: Teen wants maximum freedom while parents want strict supervision and limitations
context.expected_outcome: Agreed-upon driving rules with clear consequences and graduated freedom

participants.name: Mark Anderson

behavioral_traits.emotional_tells: Voice gets sterner when discussing safety concerns

sample_dialogue: Some things are non-negotiable - no friends in the car for the first six months.
These aren't arbitrary rules - they're based on accident statistics for new drivers.
You'll earn more privileges by proving you can handle the responsibility.

participants.name: Tyler Anderson

behavioral_traits.verbal_tics: Says 'I promise' frequently, bounces in seat
behavioral_traits.emotional_tells: Voice gets higher when excited about driving freedom

sample_dialogue: I promise I'll be super careful - I've been preparing for this for months!
Come on, Dad - all my friends get to drive their friends around.
I'll follow every rule perfectly if you just give me a chance to prove myself.

participants.name: Susan Anderson

behavioral_traits.speech_patterns: Seeks middle ground, references Tyler's maturity
behavioral_traits.verbal_tics: Says 'maybe we could' frequently, looks between father and son
behavioral_traits.emotional_tells: Voice gets softer when mediating between family members

sample_dialogue: Maybe we could start with short trips and see how it goes?
Tyler has shown good judgment in other areas - let's give him some credit.
What if we had a check-in system so everyone feels comfortable?

conversation_flow.description: Tyler celebrates passing test, Mark immediately discusses rules, Susan mediates
Back and forth on specific rules, safety concerns versus freedom desires
Graduated privilege system with clear milestones and review periods

specific_assignments.context: Demonstrate commitment to safe driving practices and earn additional privileges

specific_assignments.task: Create written driving agreement with clear rules and consequences
specific_assignments.context: Document all agreements so expectations are clear for entire family

scheduled_items.date_time: Every Sunday at 6 PM for next 3 months
scheduled_items.purpose: Review driving performance and adjust privileges based on demonstrated responsibility

scenarios.scenario_title: Friend Group Conflict - Event Planning Disagreement

context.setting: Coffee shop, informal meeting to plan mutual friend's surprise birthday
context.background: Close friend group planning surprise party with different ideas about budget and style
context.tension_point: One friend wants elaborate expensive party while others prefer simple, intimate gathering
context.expected_outcome: Unified party plan that everyone can support and afford

participants.name: Rachel Green

behavioral_traits.speech_patterns: Dramatic, uses lots of adjectives and exclamations
behavioral_traits.under_pressure: Gets more animated, talks with hands
behavioral_traits.verbal_tics: Says 'it'll be amazing' frequently, shows pictures on phone
behavioral_traits.emotional_tells: Voice gets higher when excited about party ideas

sample_dialogue: It'll be amazing - we could rent that gorgeous rooftop venue downtown!
This is her 30th birthday - it has to be absolutely spectacular!
We can split the costs - it's only like $150 per person if we all chip in.

participants.name: David Kim

behavioral_traits.verbal_tics: Says 'have we considered' frequently, checks notes
behavioral_traits.emotional_tells: Speaks slower when trying to be diplomatic about budget

sample_dialogue: Have we considered that not everyone in our group can afford $150?
She's pretty low-key - would she actually want something this elaborate?
What about liability and logistics - who's handling all the details?

participants.name: Lisa Martinez

behavioral_traits.under_pressure: Focuses on group harmony and inclusion
behavioral_traits.verbal_tics: Says 'what if we' frequently, nods encouragingly
behavioral_traits.emotional_tells: Voice gets softer when trying to mediate disagreement

sample_dialogue: What if we found a middle ground that's special but not overwhelming?
I think we all want to celebrate her - let's find something everyone can support.
Maybe we could do something intimate but still really meaningful?

conversation_flow.description: Rachel proposes elaborate party, David raises practical concerns, Lisa seeks compromise
Discussion of budget limitations and friend's actual preferences
Compromise on elegant but affordable gathering at someone's home

specific_assignments.context: Create elegant atmosphere within agreed budget at home venue

specific_assignments.task: Organize food coordination and guest communication
specific_assignments.context: Ensure all invited friends know about potluck assignments and party details

scheduled_items.date_time: Two days before party at 7 PM
scheduled_items.purpose: Coordinate final details and ensure everything is ready for surprise party
